title: How to Draw a Blue Whale

steps.headline: Draw three ovals as a basis for the body of your whale.
steps.description: It should resemble an earthworm at this point, with segments connected by guidelines (if you want any).

steps.headline: Sketch small circles for the eyes.
steps.description: They should be located just above the line for the mouth. Draw ovals for the flippers, a small triangle for the dorsal fin, and another set of ovals for the tail fins.

steps.headline: Sketch in a few more details, then outline the drawing.
steps.description: Make sure to include the gently curving lines underneath the whale's face. Erase unnecessary guidelines.

steps.headline: Color in your the whale and you are done.
steps.description: Unlike the name suggests, blue whales are not bright blue; use greys and other pale colors to fill in your whale.

text: Draw three ovals as a basis for the body of your whale. It should resemble an earthworm at this point, with segments connected by guidelines (if you want any). Sketch small circles for the eyes. They should be located just above the line for the mouth. Draw ovals for the flippers, a small triangle for the dorsal fin, and another set of ovals for the tail fins. Sketch in a few more details, then outline the drawing. Make sure to include the gently curving lines underneath the whale's face. Erase unnecessary guidelines. Color in your the whale and you are done. Unlike the name suggests, blue whales are not bright blue; use greys and other pale colors to fill in your whale.
